contents.title: (MaHeck, Don. Marvel Masterworks Presents Iron Man

notes: (Marvel Masterworks ; v. 20)
Reprinting the Iron Man stories from Tales of Suspense, no. 39 (Mar. 1963) - no. 55 (July 1964)

In the first story playboy munitions manufacturer Tony Stark is shown coming to the aid of U.S. forces in Vietnam, and most of the story takes place in North Vietnam. 1. Superhero comics. 2. Vietnamese Conflict, 1961-1975

notes: Summary: Roland Hedley introduces his voyage into the brain of Ronald Reagan.

135.title: Hedley, Roland
135.author: G
135.appears_in: B. Trudeau. reprinted on p. 41 of Mother Jones, v. 6, no. 2 (Feb./Mar. 1981)
notes: Summary: Hedley begins the tour of the brain of Ronald Reagan, talking about 5-cent Cokes, Burma Shave signs, Angola, Iran, Korea, Cyprus, Cuba, Lebanon, and using terminology like fornix, hypothalamus, and marbles.

136.title: Hedley, Roland
136.author: G
136.series: Oct. 29, 1980) "Mr. Reagan's Ability to Reconcile Huge Tax Cuts with Massive Military Spending Must Be Viewed with Some Sympathy"*
136.appears_in: B. Trudeau. reprinted on p. 42 of Mother Jones, v. 6, no. 2 (Feb./Mar. 1981)
notes: Summary: Hedley points out the results of sleep deprivation on Reagan's cerebrum, usually charged with logic and critical thinking but now compensating with hallucination.

137.title: Hedley, Roland
137.author: G
137.series: Oct. 30, 1980) "The Brain of Ronald Reagan has been Shrinking Ever Since 1931"*
137.appears_in: B. Trudeau. reprinted on p. 42 of Mother Jones, v. 6, no. 2 (Feb./Mar. 1981)
notes: Summary: Roland Hedley is in the cerebellum, and mentions that the brain stops growing at age 20.

138.title: Hedley, Roland
138.author: G
138.series: Oct. 31, 1980) "Instead of Looking Forward Through Clear Eyes, Reagan is Only Able to See Backwards Through a Rose-Colored Mist"*
138.appears_in: B. Trudeau. reprinted on p. 42 of Mother Jones, v. 6, no. 2 (Feb./Mar. 1981)
notes: Summary: Hedley visits the visual cortex in Ronald Reagan's brain.

139.title: Hedley, Roland
139.author: G
139.series: June 2, 1987) "We Think He Must Have Walked Through a Metal Detector"*
notes: Summary: Hedley dedicates his testimony to his cameraman, who died in the President's brain during a sudden brainstorm.

contents.author: G.B. Trudeau.
contents.title: Hedley, Roland (June 5, 1987) "Did It Ever Occur to You that a Massive Explosion Inside Mr. Reagan's Brain might Adversely Affect his Subsequent Mental Performance?"* (Doonesbury, June 5, 1987)

notes: Summary: Roland Hedley is testifying at a hearing about hurling an incendiary device at the President's fornix.
